result.execSummary:
The defendant John A Cecot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Stephanie W. to be paid as a condition of probation before costs or fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with Stephanie W., Ryan G., and Katherine P. 
Provide DNA Sample unless previously done.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours.  Release for standard conditions. To report on 7/20/16 by 6:00 p.m.
To be completed as a condition of probation as directed by Agent.

Defendant John A Cecot in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Counts 1, 2 and 3,  Court finds defendant guilty. Attorney Bricco requests the Court schedule a seperate sentencing/restitution hearing.   The Court schedules accordingly. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant John A Cecot in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective William Majeskie from the City of New Berlin Police Department, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Bricco. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over and provides closing statements. Atty. Bricco objects to bind over and provides closing statement.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing at 02-04-2016 10:00 am

Defendant John A Cecot in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 12-14-2015 10:00 am

Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant John A Cecot in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicates he was expecting an attorney, but if they did not appear that he would like to speak to the Public Defender.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
